I found it hard to keep on top of docs, with screenshots and videos taking a lot of time. Of course in those companies it is mostly likely the same person writing the docs and taking screenshots.

That said if this tool could be useful to large companies that would also be great

The demo Iâ€™ve built is doesnâ€™t interfere with the customer site at all, and doesnâ€™t require a browser plugin. Instead it loads the site being documented in an iframe. Of course that could be a problem depending on the customerâ€™s Content-Security-Policy, Iâ€™m hoping for the majority of users it will be fine as theyâ€™ll be able to run the docs app on their own subdomain. Worst case scenario theyâ€™ll have to modify their frame-src directive to include that domain.

When you say yearly licence do you mean for an entirely self-hosted on site version (ie: both the docs and the tool to create them are self-hosted)? As thatâ€™s a road I definitely do not want to go down. The back end service is required even if youâ€™re exporting docâ€™s HTML for self hosting, as the screenshots and videos are initially saved locally as blobs, those blobs need to be uploaded to a server for the rest of the world to see.

Documentation is always a poor child and the biggest hurdle is that the people writing the documentation are always asking for screen shotsâ€¦and no one in the team has time to do those screen shot for themâ€¦ and often times, they donâ€™t have full access to a customer version of the app (we do custom dev tooâ€¦large enterprisesâ€¦) Nice also that you can get a movie out of it simplyâ€¦ That is way coolâ€¦ It should not interfere with our app though, so it is a browser extension? That would be the bestâ€¦

I sure would have our doc team look at it. Not sure about the monthly model though. Much easier to get a licence price for itâ€¦ even if it is for one year maintenanceâ€¦ 300$ per seat is a no brainerâ€¦ even more is possible I think â€¦ I would actually try it at 799$ a seat with enterprise and see what you getâ€¦

Naturally, self hosting is a must for usecases like the one I am talking about. Even if I was documenting one of my own apps, I would want to self hostâ€¦ Splits my brain to have my doc hosted on another hostâ€¦
